ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Performs (simultaneous) inferences for ratios of linear combinations of coefficients in the general linear model. Multiple comparisons and simultaneous confidence interval estimations can be performed for ratios of treatment means in the normal one-way layout with homogeneous and heterogeneous treatment variances, according to Dilba et al. (2007) <https://cran.r-project.org/doc/Rnews/Rnews_2007-1.pdf> and Hasler and Hothorn (2008) <doi:10.1002/bimj.200710466>. Confidence interval estimations for ratios of linear combinations of linear model parameters like in (multiple) slope ratio and parallel line assays can be carried out. Moreover, it is possible to calculate the sample sizes required in comparisons with a control based on relative margins. For the simple two-sample problem, functions for a t-test for ratio-formatted hypotheses and the corresponding confidence interval are provided assuming homogeneous or heterogeneous group variances.

Performs (simultaneous) inferences for ratios of linear combinations of coefficients in the general linear model. Multiple comparisons and simultaneous confidence interval estimations can be performed for ratios of treatment means in the normal one-way layout with homogeneous and heterogeneous treatment variances, according to Dilba et al. (2007) <https://cran.r-project.org/doc/Rnews/Rnews_2007-1.pdf> and Hasler and Hothorn (2008) <doi:10.1002/bimj.200710466>. Confidence interval estimations for ratios of linear combinations of linear model parameters like in (multiple) slope ratio and parallel line assays can be carried out. Moreover, it is possible to calculate the sample sizes required in comparisons with a control based on relative margins. For the simple two-sample problem, functions for a t-test for ratio-formatted hypotheses and the corresponding confidence interval are provided assuming homogeneous or heterogeneous group variances.

name: r-mratios
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.4.4" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-mratios
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: mratios_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/mratios_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/mratios/mratios_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8aa0dce02f55760e0e5a7406c78378967b3ddfe35a52e973c10bc2fbfb5df601

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mvtnorm
    - r-multcomp
    - r-survival
    - r-survpresmooth
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mvtnorm
    - r-multcomp
    - r-survival
    - r-survpresmooth

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('mratios')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('mratios')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mratios
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: Performs (simultaneous) inferences for ratios of linear combinations of coefficients in the general linear model. Multiple comparisons and simultaneous confidence interval estimations can be performed for ratios of treatment means in the normal one-way layout with homogeneous and heterogeneous treatment variances,
    according to Dilba et al. (2007) <https://cran.r-project.org/doc/Rnews/Rnews_2007-1.pdf> and Hasler and Hothorn (2008) <doi:10.1002/bimj.200710466>. Confidence interval estimations for ratios of linear combinations of linear model parameters like in (multiple) slope ratio and parallel line assays can be carried out.
    Moreover, it is possible to calculate the sample sizes required in comparisons with a control based on relative margins. For the simple two-sample problem, functions for a t-test for ratio-formatted hypotheses and the corresponding confidence interval are provided assuming homogeneous or heterogeneous group variances.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
